top_categories.workout_context: The Mane Event Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
The Mane Event Gravel’s wyoming mountains, mountain gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at The Mane Event Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of The Mane Event Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Racing The Mane Event Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The Mane Event Gravel’s wyoming mountains gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The varied gradients at The Mane Event Gravel reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at The Mane Event Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for The Mane Event Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at The Mane Event Gravel count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
The Mane Event Gravel’s wyoming mountains gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Every session at The Mane Event Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for The Mane Event Gravel’s 55 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at The Mane Event Gravel. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The Mane Event Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wyoming mountains gravel to build confidence. Expect: wyoming mountains, mountain gravel, high altitude.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 55 miles of wyoming mountains gravel in Sheridan, WY.
